Hgqztt5WJC9EG_tzfbH6Gw.text: A beautiful location to brunch and people watch.  The food was quite good, tea so-so, cocktails were ok.  Ambiance totally made up for it! I've heard other locations are awesome too.Definitely check out the gardens or request to sit there.In the summer I'm sure it gets crazy packed. We made reservations for lunch on a rainy Wednesday (no outside seating) and it was quite busy so make your reservations if you even think it will be remotely busy.

ryVBkkIxIAP-ulCGVIvtfg.text: Visited tonight for their soft launch, and what a place! The new design has a lovely Parisian feel without being too pretentious or  offputting. The garden- oh the garden!! Is bigger than the inside and dotted with cozy seating, water features and even fireplaces....will be a lovely setting for a summer drinks party! Exactly what the Kings road had been lacking- a cosy, destination restaurant! Well done!

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Huge back garden

vSS60w4bZ17TdZMUNsJb3g.text: This place has a GORGEOUS garden. I mean I haven't seen a garden like it yet in London! The food was really nice (we only got light bites/starters) like the arancini balls, fried zucchini, and wasabi prawns. The amount that comes in each starter is very generous (definitely very full by the end!) We even ordered more arancini balls because they were that good. My reason for not giving this place a 5 star rating is because I realised the following day, that they had forgotten to bring us our sourdough bread (that we had ordered) and also charged us for it lol. That was a bit sloppy and not expected from such a nice, Chelsea-based place! But will definitely go back many times; they got me addicted to those arancini balls!!! Mmm!

qBQJ9gNkAZB6lzahciLTjQ.text: Good cocktails. Awesome decorum. The crowd is definitely what makes it. Chelsea is perfectly encapsulated in this art deco spot.

AdDaiFSNthcf7FR6iQfEWg.text: Good decor, a mix of lots of young glam Mommys with baby's in pushchairs, and business lunch types. Despite being a regular the initial service was agonisingly slow and generally inattentive ... It did improve during the meal. The food is in a word..average! Not bad but not great!

s9OGtupWtylnTPR2ywIqtw.text: I enjoyed my experience at The Ivy very much. We received great service from the staff, although the rigatoni dish I chose looked much better than it tasted (just a bit plain). Very nice atmosphere in the restaurant itself (dimly lit and warm). I would recommend this place to a friend. Make sure to book in advance.

KOvXzzy6E99BSb5KriTGzg.text: Had a completely delicious and reasonably low key breakfast here last weekend.  Prices really quite reasonable for what you get.  And the coffee was superb!

6AKOTAmKsoAf9OAzCr_Gug.text: Was really looking forward to our booking here however couldn't help but leave somewhat disappointed. Our reservation was for 9:30am and our whole party had finished their meals by 9:55am. Disappointing to say the least as the meals are obviously pre-cooked and heated up before being served... Although the waiters were helpful and friendly we also couldn't help but feel like there was constantly someone buzzing around us or checking our plates rather than just letting us enjoy our meal... Finally, our main purpose for visiting was to be able to enjoy the beautiful gardens. Unfortunately, you don't have this option at breakfast time & you have to be dining there for lunch.. We asked if we could sit out there for a cocktail after breakfast but was told "no one is allowed there today because a party was booked" which then shortly after, this was changed too "only if you were eating lunch..." On such a beautiful day, it's a real shame that the option to sit outside for breakfast wasn't available!

2WyP_uGH02mCTQKPfjl0lQ.text: Terrible food with a limp menu that shows no imagination. My Dover sole was a soggy swimming in oil mess that had to be sent back. The place itself is lovely but there are many better places to eat to see and be seen.

U9lyve-0Df2dSeY0pf93tQ.text: Wonderful establishment!  So summery, definitely recommend for warm weather outdoor eating.  James is amazing and made our meal on our honeymoon one to remember.  The interior design is to die for. I would love to come back for brunch, menu looks amazing.

XeuPUe94tXJJQ5lR9Kpwfw.text: Good food but the WORST, SLOW, and RUDE service I've ever seen in my life. The one star is just for the food lol.

eMgJz0PRsDZvdP3b0n2g5Q.text: I came here with a girlfriend for lunch and was very pleasantly surprised. I was never a fan of the original Ivy, grimy with a tired old menu, fairly poorly executed. This is quite a different sort of place, it's light and airy with decor based around the nearby Chelsea Physic Garden. Cocktails are reasonably priced and named after local icons. There is a good selection of small dishes, 'sandwiches' and reworked Ivy staples. The staff were perhaps a little over attentive - I'm not a big fan of being asked, mid mouthful, how my food is. The garden looks fabulous, but it was a little too overcast today to warrant a table outside. I will definitely be back soon with my husband for dinner, although finding a table in the foreseeable future may prove a challenge

g4OcxK3elRVfI_B_SrX32A.text: This place seems more of a place to be seen and not so much about the food. French style food, but not that great. the decor is beautiful and the outside patio is also very pretty. you feel like you are eating in a lush garden.We Ordered:1. Wild Mushrooms on toasted brioche: This was delicious! salted mushrooms came in a light cream sauce that had grated truffles and gran moravia.2. Smoked Salmon and crab: This smoked salmon was a nova sliced as a thin sheet piece. I am not a fan of the texture of nova or lox (prefer hot smoked salmon), so i did not care for this dish. My husband liked it!   3. Chelsea Garden Fish Cake: I typically like fish cakes, crab cakes, anything with a cake. But this did not do it for me. The cake was large, but had no seasoning and had a fishy flavor. The texture was too pureed  for my liking on the inside. I prefer my cakes when i can still see chunks or lumps or crab or fish. It came with poached hens egg and hollandaise. don't think i would order this again.4. Steak, eggs, and chips: This was just okay. The steak had no flavor. Chips (fries) tasted fine, but needed salt (order the truffle fries next time).Overall, The service was great! Very charming ambience. The inside can get very loud bc it gets very busy. You need reservations, this place is very popular.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Garden
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Fish cake
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Steak and eggs

PD17g3Ac0UfSZhdu1mwtgQ.text: Extraordinary all the way around. The service was impeccable. The restaurant was so fun and full of life and plants. It was truly a unique experience having brunch here. We made a reservation on open table ahead of time and we're sat immediately. I would highly recommend this to anyone visiting London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom

qfzHD9L96hNd0_MneTjYTQ.text: Racist staff. No more to say. I want this to count as a review and not a tip so I'm going to keep typing. But yeah don't eat here if you care about black people. If you haven't seen it with your own eyes I recommend you go to social media to see what BS they've been up to.

BVyCF36vAko4g41QV-ULWw.text: Great service, absolutely brilliant venue and great food at a reasonable price. The venue "appears" to be expensive, however the menu says otherwise! Was very happy with the experience here and would highly recommend.

lGB_3nMqXoeJtn9TTnMD9A.text: Excer food and service by the beautiful Garden. Great ambiance to relax around beautiful gardens, drinking champagne with very good food.

9UKeD5xwvLqNSxWNmRamZg.text: I wanted to have brunch in Chelsea and in the end decided on The Ivy Chelsea Garden and wound up having the most delicious brunch!First of all, the restaurant is beautiful. Not just the interior, but the people also. All of the ladies are in lovely green dresses and the men in green vests. Having Garden in the name of course means that there has to be beautiful outdoor seating. I was really lucky to be able to enjoy brunch in the indoor patio, surrounded by lovely flowers and a view of the out door fire pit.Now the food - delicious!! First we started with cocktails - the Sloane Ranger for my husband and the Lavender Lady for me. Two of the best cocktails we've ever had. Because I was in London I ordered crumpets for the first time and omg so good. My husband tried one bite and in the end wound up eating the entire crumpet. For our mains we ordered coffee, eggs royale, eggs benedict with avocado and spinach, and a side of fruit salad. Yum!Definitely recommend The Ivy Chelsea Garden for anyone wanting a chic, beautiful, delicious brunch or lunch in Chelsea! Be sure to make your reservation ahead of time!

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Outdoor fire pit
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Toasted crumpets served with Marmite, mustard, and parsley butter
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Avocado and Spinach Benedict: sliced avocado, raw baby spinach and two poached hen's eggs on toasted English muffins with Hollandaise sauce

NYdsFOLaAtdMy6LZ2ymt7w.text: This is a hard spot to get a reservation, but-for me- it is a must for anyone in London. Request to sit outside in the garden, or at least near it, for the nicest surroundings. The food is pricey, but it is perfectly cooked and very creative. The area is also very nice, certainly worth checking out for travelers

Ea47kdae13Br3QvyutB4Ug.text: Cons -  whatever they do well are not these menu itemsAfternoon Tea When does a cucumber sandwich ever taste goodScone - is that why they use clotted cream to make hard dry bread eat ableLobster - Where's the beef. Couldn't find a ounce of lobster to save my lifeTuna crudo with avocado- taste like I was eating a sour limeBuffala- presentation looks good. Flavor profile was sloppy and unremarkable PROSAtmosphere was very "smart" and nice. You are dining in an English tea garden. What can you say. Eat on the patio.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Lavender lady. Review was good
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Meh  only whiskey cocktail. This is a big gin town
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Arancini

B5BnCK_JNFD8yYF4R00maw.text: Really great location, setting and service. That's about it. The food menu is appetizing to read but the quality just isn't there and I think it's a mix of produce and skills. The avocado wasn't barely ripe, bacon fatty and the bread dry. It's not terrible either but just not up to scratch compared to smaller, less fancy places. Worth a visit for the experience but don't expect a food revelation.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Truffle scrabbled eggs

jqM35KVBkzgb9Ed1fNz_HQ.text: This is definitely the place where the fashionable and hip Chelsea set go and you can tell that immediately with an almost club like welcome at the front reception. There are two doors to The Ivy Chelsea one is from the street, the next is the door from reception into the restaurant and bar so you have to 'check-in' (and be checked out) by the host/hostesses who guard the door like bouncers, even if you are going for just cocktails. And there is definitely an airport style profiling before you go in... are you chic enough to enter? Let's see... Once inside the decor is lovely and delightful. An almost retro Chelsea chintz of green and pink with antique floral prints on the walls. It is pleasing and not at all dowdy yet you can't help but feel it is very grown up and indeed much of the clientele are the establishment of tailored suits and Hermes bags. But not to worry young trendsetters there is a place here for you too as many of the Made in Chelsea cast hang out here and indeed such luxe lifestyle bloggers and Instagramers as well sooooo that means it is the place du jour to be especially for brunches and champagne. And why not this place was made for Chelsea, refined, classic, and pretty, right on King's Road, why on earth didn't this happen sooner!?! Thankfully The Ivy Chelsea has the substance to back up the veneer as the food is quite simply wonderful. Tasty food, traditional menu with a bit of flare, and a good wine list make it a great place to actually go and EAT! The fish cakes are some of the best I've ever tasted, and the desserts... well the Chocolate Bomb with its spectacular presentation was scrumptious. In the warmer months there is garden seating which makes the restaurant even more appealing and I am sure everyone will be there during Chelsea Flower Show season. The bar has a great cocktail list and capable bartenders to make this a local watering hole. That is... if you can get past the front door...

mbh7bogZLVqIuU8Q6MRnyQ.text: What a gorgeous restaurant - absolutely stunning decor & environment. Gorgeous indoors area, and even more gorgeous covered & closed conservatory with fires, so amazing even in winter. The Garden is just as amazing, also with fires. We weren't lucky enough to be in conservatory, but definitely want to make sure to head there again in spring & summer. Absolutely stunning. Brekkie/Brunch was lovely - amoungst ourselves we managed to try the Full English (lovely plate, all ingredients the best quality, but the black pudding was the size of a two pound coin - they could have been a little more generous), the Garden Breakfast, Avocado, Tomato & Sesame & The Avocado & Spinach Eggs Benedict. Quick note on cost - keeping in mind we didn't drink alcohol, it was crazy cheap! Definitely not what I expected! Always a good surprise! Overall, the food was good, nothing extraordinary but good. And the decor was stunning. I highly recommend for a special occasion or not necessarily!

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Avocado & spinach eggs benedict
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Full english
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom

H36t48sPvym11vX-xF73iQ.text: CRAZY place with wonderful staff and a menu that can satisfy anyone.  I could spend an hour praising this place but let's leave it at " a place you must experience" and call it a day.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom

idDJZomXDehCPEVmy3Qrog.text: Please note that this a brunch review, not dinner.Overall I wasn't very impressed with the Ivy in terms of the quality of the food. Pros:- The service was great, it was attentive and polite. - Great atmosphere and decor. The Ivy is vibrant and busy, but not in a loud obnoxious wayCons:- The food - all of it- The toast was brought out well before the dishes so we were left with cold toast to eat- The eggs benedict was poorly presented and prepared. The watercress was clumsily thrown on and the shredded ham was lacking in flavor- The muffins on the egg bendedict was truly terrible. One of the worst I've had- The veggie full breakfast left a lot to be desired as well. The beans seemed to be straight from Heinz (which is fine for home but I'd expect more at a restaurant). The eggs had a school cafeteria look and feel to themI'm not sure if dinner is better, but given the poor quality of brunch I doubt I'll come back to try it.

0vf73aPCKL_0W743REvFFw.text: Not worth your time, i think people come for the scene rather than the food. Despite the hosts turning people away for being "fully booked", the restaurant had too many empty tables.Food, nothing to write home about, nothing wrong but nothing that great. I think if you're looking for a good meal, you may come here once but then i doubt you'll return.

GFtFo2QWrFuu8rdEP0_Kzw.text: Lovely setting in south Kensington but other than that nothing impressive. Food is solid and good and well presented but not sure about the provenance of the place. Menu touches England and then everywhere else? Very international staff (mostly Russian??) wearing some interesting uniforms. I would recommend this place to those who don't dine out often and want the illusion of a fine dining meal. They do have foie gras in the menu and it was tasty. Nothing jumped out at us and deserts weren't even worth ordering.

U_PH49AUUt7so94mIP4Fmw.text: My heart sank on reading the menu. Burgers and fish and chips? Brasserie standards. Meh. However, in reality, there's a bit more to it, although it is true that the menu is fairly middle-of -the-road. Warm duck salad was very good, as were scallops with fennel and grapefruit. Rump steak was excellent, as was the lemon sole. The only "showy" item we found was on the dessert menu- the chocolate bombe arriving with a warm praline sauce that causes structural collapse on the chocolate shell. A bit of a shame, in some respects, as you just end up with an amorphous ( but delicious) swamp.Tea, lunch, and brunch menus are also available.The wine list is good- actually far more extensive than merited by the narrow menu. Some nice (relative) oddities in there, like a good Prinz bob Hessen Riesling (2013). Lots of good stuff around the £30/bottle mark.As to the restaurant itself- well , you may well want to be in the garden room with the hedgies, foreign plutocrats, and other glossy denizens of Chelsea, although it has to be said most of them are basically there to look at themselves. There are about a million staff- most of the wait staff are very good, and service is generally attentive ( until it gets busy).Front of house is manned by that special breed of decorative but inexplicably arrogant person who gets off on asking people if they've booked ( well, I suppose it's do this or work in Daddy's gallery).All in all, an unchallenging eaterie for the fairly well heeled- the sort of place you might go with a wealthy, elderly aunt. Won't scare the horses, sort of thing. Absolutely nothing wrong with that in and of itself, but you can't help but feel it could be a bit more...well, adventurous on the menu front.

Bu79MRjDUpLYwI6EMTfmag.text: Had Salmon with a side of fried vegetables, wouldn't go there again. The decoration and atmosphere was nice.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom

YIiU1QeKjdIzbOcabK1Fjw.text: I recently made a trip to The Ivy Chelsea Garden for my friend's birthday and was stunned by the interior - if you haven't made a trip make sure you do either for a formal dinner in a beautiful setting or for an indulgent brunch outside in the beautiful garden.The food is delicious and the service is excellent - the staff are extremely attentive and were happy to suggest what to eat to us. I had the 'mushrooms on toast', the roast chicken and the treacle tart and it was all delicious - each course was also beautifully presented. Make sure you try the chocolate bomb too, my friend had this and as well it was being delicious it was lovely having the waiter pour the hot sauce over the solid chocolate case and watching it melt away to reveal the dessert. Highly recommend for dinner or brunch in Chelsea - a little expensive but definitely worth the price!

Fwo_ae23b5ttMK5PlShSxA.text: Delicious breakfast food and a great variety of teas. The decor is beautiful and he staff are very friendly and attentive.

x8637VQAf4jj5060ScKIAw.text: Yay! I'm a fan.Well, not really. I don't tend to go for Gordon Ramsay but I was walking along Kings Road on a Thursday night with a friend and there didn't seem to be many other enticing places, so we went in here.What did we get?Excellent service. No really, like proper effort put in. I felt genuinely welcomed.Nice atmosphere. There was a buzz and people were happily chatting away. The decor wasn't over the top and it wasn't too plain either. It had a classy feel but still had a bit of a buzz to it. Again, well done.Food... well, ok, again, yes it was very good. But the portion was pretty small.Wine... Very good selection, but this is where you really feel your wallet pinch. The place would actually be much nicer for me if they didn't quadruple the price of the wine, and that's why it's dropping a star.OK, so yeah... it seems I am a fan! Yay!

vBqzHL8KwbKFfLBbEhcrfQ.text: The exterior is beautiful and the interior atmosphere is absolutely to die for. I felt like I was in a very cozy, luxurious sun room with plants all around and lots of beautiful accents. The patio space in the very back is also gorgeous with twinkle lights providing a nice glow in the evenings. Beware that those sitting outside may be doing so to smoke so request a seat inside to avoid the second-hand smoke that may drift your way if this is something that bothers you.The food was amazing. I ordered a very interesting salad that was unlike anything I had ever eaten before and it was delicious. The fries were great and all at my table were very satisfied with their meals.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful exterior

rq-6prI0vlRxMGoG9cGPZg.text: This restaurant is one of the most beautiful places I've ever been to. The decor and flowers are gorgeous and the back patio is amazing. Unfortunately the service and the food did not match up. My husband and I arrived 20 minutes early to our reservation and were told to wait. We waited and waited...which I figured was fine since we were early. But then we watched people come in and be seated over and over again until it was well past our reservation time. A few staff members even asked us if we were still waiting so I knew were weren't forgotten about...so that was odd. We ordered the HLT sandwich and the French Dip. Both were good but not wow. The chips however were delicious, perfectly crispy and fluffy. I wouldn't go back because of the food and service but the place really is something to see, especially out in the garden.

FaZfT6pWz88YN7i-SFIYuA.text: The outdoor patio is amazing but you can only be seated if you have a reservation.Food was just average in my opinion but the decor and ambiance is nice! Also great neighborhood away from the tourist..

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. The ivy refresher (its like a virgin mojito)

lplVm6Cq8v72bF3D7nUdkQ.text: We had a lovely lunch at the Ivy, but the service and the lack of "knock your socks off" factor in the food made me give it a 3. We made lunch reservations and were seated in the back near the garden which was lovely. We ordered two appetizers- the seasonal pumpkin soup and the mushroom cream toast. Both were excellent! We also got coffee and early Grey tea which were great. However, I ordered a cocktail as well and they brought me an iced tea. I questioned two people if it was the right thing and they said it was. Finally, 20 minutes later the waiter realized I was right and brought me the cocktail. For our mains we ordered the truffle chicken sandwich and the burger. Both were very yummy. However, the waiter seemed to not know much about the dishes, just said they were "nice" and couldn't give much details, hence the semi-boring orders on our part. Overall, it was a nice lunch, but didn't knock it out of the park.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. The outside decorated for Christmas
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Mushroom cream toast. Yum!
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Seasonal soup- pumpkin with ricotta

oR1LXtGBBrUr0KidTMJ2cQ.text: Nice environment, and romantic place. Food is also great  and especially the dessert. I oredered crème brulee, it is delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom

CcSTBA_2Nf-yzt4LnONpHQ.text: It is not my first time in The Ivy restaurants but it was in this one.The place is really beautiful and the garden made it unique.As always, their cappucino are delicious and their pastries are pretty good.I ate for the first time the Vegetarian full breakfast and it was delicious! Good quantity, good products, I wasn't disappointed.Also, we shared some crumpets, granary toasts and fresh fruits.Nothing to complain about, the service and the food are good.I can't wait to go back to this place !

J8bmrmAmwZOI76TN9H6NtA.text: Gosh everything was amazing BUT the service. Our server, a young lady just ignored for some reason, never smiled and was genuinely unhappy enough were there. We bought a bottle of house bubbly and she seemed determined not to refill our glasses. The food and setting were a 10 but I can't remember a worse service in 10 years or more. Wish we kept the check for her name, she is tanking the Ivy reputation.

sbq2WrIi8AN-pK2LZ5KRJg.text: The atmosphere, decor and garden are stunning and worth visiting. My Mom and I went for lunch. I ordered the crab pasta and a red Grenache and thoroughly enjoyed both. The pasta was light, with veggies and had a simple deliciousness. The waiter helped me decide between that and another dish and he had lots of knowledge about the food and wine served. My mom got a rose Grenache and the chicken salad and did not like her dish. She said the chicken was tough and the salad bland. We each ordered dessert-lemon something or other out of this world and crem brûlée which she enjoyed along with the heavier port. I would go back!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom

1fcesorraay0r5d6lnTLcw.text: If you are in this area you should definitely check this restaurant out. We wanted to find a place for Christmas eve brunch and this was a great find. I recommend getting reservations because they can get quite busy, especially during the holiday season. This restaurant is beautiful inside and out! Great food and great coffee. I ordered the avocado toast and the portion size was great! The coffee was also amazing and would go back just for the coffee.  The prices were very reasonable as well. And the service here is great! Was very impressed with our waitress.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom

ZoEvuM-Hfa-x15syIR42Xg.text: Despite the crowd this place is worth visiting. Lovely countryside design and especially cozy part is orangeries with fireplace.Service was very good

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Fish pie

WMpsZIEnpxFiDb8yml8X-Q.text: Definitely enjoyed the experience here! The servers were all friendly and the meal was great! Would recommend the truffle rice ball (forgor the name) and tempura shrimp! We got a table close to the garden so it felt relaxing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Blackened cod fillet

fABa_kS7nO8BW7UsVanagg.text: Great service and location. Food? MediocreLove the patio seating and how attentive the staff is.  My salmon Benedict was OK. Nothing special. Definitely overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom. Salmon benedict

H0VAZDzr4sBA4bBvDLNCaQ.text: I didn't have too many expectations when I booked this place. I thought the food would be ok and that you pay for the nice garden and room. But I was quite wrong! The food is very good and generous! The quantities are nice, it's not too much! I can't wait to go back through summer time to have lunch in the garden this time!

photos.caption: Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Ivy Chelsea Garden - London, United Kingdom

dT-1ZiurqnSkUS7pLaa5zQ.text: Loved the environment more than anything, it was so beautiful. I recommend asking for a table in the back terrace. I enjoyed the crispy duck salad for lunch, and the ivy cooler was refreshing.

J-W7zbM-QW44daTW99PPiQ.text: Great food. Sucks that I couldn't eat at the bar the second time I went due to licenses. Never heard of that. But the food and drinks were amazing!!!!!

6dpSiu8XalkQmK4f7XdGFw.text: What a great place! I frequent this and have met everyone from parents for brunch, a date for dinner, some old friends and even someone's mother for some coffee. Good food. The Chocolate Bombe is a must! Also the vegetarian options are satisfying and nutritious. The courgette fries must also get a mention, they come in a large basket and thus are perfect to share. I hope you learn to live this chain just as much as I do.

GdOxnNNr1SBjkf6ouOinNw.text: Horribly racist establishment. No clear guidance on dress code but still has the audacity to use as a reason to discriminate against people based off of race. Strongly advise against supporting this establishment with your money.

Rc-OCap7EyHs-ccR6D0d0w.text: Lovey dinner! Duck and goat cheese on endive salads were delicious! Steak tartare for dinner with a side of spinach soufflé for me, my partner ordered a fish dish that he enjoyed. Two shared desserts...apple tart flambé and a chocolate bomb with caramel chunks (like pop rocks!) with creme to die for!

9fiHGioRvxIN5WAMABQ1YQ.text: I kept hearing about this restaurant and i was dying to try it. Everyone said to book the garden & so i did. But, No one told me about the mice! I saw atleast 3-4 in the bushes and they kept going under my feet- to say the least, i lost my appetite :(I cancelled my main course and asked for the bill. But the food i tried was yummy & the man serving us was v. Sweet.

vYTIYRpzuzb9a-djhvfsqw.text: This place is beautiful on the outside however the manager is an absolute jerk. We tried to go in one night to have a drink at the bar (which looked empty) and he said that we need to have a table reservation, when we asked if we could wait for the bar area seating he told us we had to wait outside and started to roll his eyes at me and my husband telling us that we had to leave speaking to us in a  very ill manner. Because we wanted to try the food we went back with reservations on another night and he was there again and refused to greet us at the door and snubbed us, anyway the food is decent but the ambiance is perfect.  I wouldn't go back here for the pure fact that the restaurant manager treats the clientele like he is too good for them - not how I want to be treated when I go out to fine dining.
